author: kfogel
msg: For issue #689: Put md5 code into its own sublibrary.
* subversion/include/svn_string.h, subversion/libsvn_subr/svn_string.c:
(svn_cstring_from_md5_digest): Move from here...
* subversion/include/svn_md5.h, subversion/libsvn_subr/md5.c: New files.
(svn_md5_digest_to_cstring): ...to here, and renamed.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_fs/fs-test.c: Include svn_md5.h.
(verify_checksum): Adjust for above rename.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/reps-strings.c: Include svn_md5.h.
(svn_fs__rep_contents, txn_body_read_rep, svn_fs__rep_undeltify):
Adjust for above rename.

author: gstein
msg: Docco!

author: gstein
msg: Further tweaks. The per-group mail generation is now working,
including option value interpolation.
* hook-scripts/mailer.py
(main): store the original params dict as the value in the groups
dict as we build it, making it easier to recover later. don't
iterate over the groups here; let the output mechanism do it since
it may have better knowledge of what/how to do that.
(MailedOutput.__init__): stash away the repos and changelist for use
(MailedOutput.generate): new method to iterate over the groups and
send mail to each one.
(SMTPOutput.finish): fix stupid reversal of args
(StandardOutput.__init__): stash the config, repos, and changelist
(StandardOutput.generate): new method to generate the output
(StandardOutput.start, StandardOutput.finish): no longer needed

author: gstein
msg: Generate the directory list for the subject line, and revamp how we
compose the subject line.
* hooks-scripts/mailer.py
(mail_subject): removed. MailedOutput.__init__ handles this now.
(MailedOutput.__init__): compute the directory list for the subject
line and then compose the bulk of the subject (i.e. no prefix)
(MailedOutput.start): new method to set up the .to_addr and
.from_addr attributes for use in mail_headers()
(MailedOutput.mail_headers): revamp composition. use the new from/to
address attributes and compose the previously generated subject
with the group-specific prefix. add \n after the headers.
(SMTPOutput.start): toss (broken) assignment of .to_addr and
.from_addr; it is now in the superclass. no longer need to write a
newline after the headers.
(PipeOutput.start): call the superclass method and use self.to_addr
for the destination rather than fetching ourselves. no need to
write a newline after the headers.

author: gstein
msg: Drop in a bunch of code to enable generating multiple messages to/from
different addresses based on matching items in the repository path and
the changed paths in the commit.
(still working on the data/control flow here, but this is a working
checkpoint before the diff grows too huge)
* hook-scripts/mailer.py
(main): call .prep_groups() on the config to prepare the per-group
and repository matching information. set up the changelist here
rather than in generate_content(). process the changelist to
determine the unique set of groups and option-params for message
generation, then generate those messages.
(determine_output): take the changelist rather than the changes
dict. shift around a bit to select a class and then init all the
classes with the same signature. don't build the subject line
here, but leave that to the class and the info we pass.
(mail_subject): pass the changelist rather than the changes dict.
fetch the prefix using the new .get() method with a hard-wired
group and params.
(MailedOutput.__init__): change the signature and generate the mail
subject here.
(MailedOuptut.mail_headers): take the (current) group and option
params for generating the email headers for this group/param set.
(SMTPOutput.__init__): new signature and all the code moves to the
new .start() method.
(SMTPOutput.start): new method with code from __init__. also stash
away the to/from addresses for use in .finish
(SMTPOutput.finish): simplify by using the to/from stashed in our
instance data.
(StandardOutput.__init__): change the signature.
(StandardOutput.start): new, empty method.
(PipeOutput.__init__): change the signature. shift the command
definition and pipe set up to the new .start() method.
(PipeOutput.start): new method to set up the pipe to the output
program.
(generate_content): take a changelist rather than the changes dict
(Config._predefined): new tuple to define the sections that we know
about, which are not user-specified groups.
(Config.__init__): collect the set of user-specified groups.
(Config.get): new method to get an option from a group, applying a
set of substitution params.
(Config.prep_groups): new method to initialize some state for
mapping a path to a group and a set of option params.
(Config.which_group): new mehthod to look up a group name and
options for a given path.
* hook-scripts/mailer.conf.example: define a new [defaults] section
and shift the subject_prefix and from/to addresses to it.
